recipe.name: Savory Korean Egg Bowl with Spicy Garlic Sauce
recipe.instructions: 1. In a pan, heat sesame oil over medium heat and sauté minced garlic until fragrant. 2. Add the beaten eggs and cook gently, stirring occasionally, until just set. 3. In a separate bowl, mix gochujang, soy sauce, and a splash of water to create the spicy garlic sauce. 4. To serve, place warm jasmine rice in a bowl, top with the cooked spinach and scrambled eggs. 5. Drizzle the spicy garlic sauce over the top, garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.

ingredients.name: eggs
ingredients.notes: beaten with a pinch of salt

recipe.name: Roasted Butternut Squash & Quinoa Salad with Ginger Citrus Vinaigrette
recipe.instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). 2. Toss cubed butternut squash with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes or until tender. 3. While the squash is roasting, cook quinoa according to package instructions. 4. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, grated ginger, orange juice, honey, salt, and pepper to make the vinaigrette. 5. In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, roasted squash, arugula, cranberries, and walnuts. Drizzle with vinaigrette, toss gently, and serve.

recipe.name: Crispy Cod Stir-Fry with Asian Vegetables and Sweet Soy Glaze
recipe.instructions: 1. Preheat oven or prepare cooking surface for Crispy Cod Stir-Fry with Asian Vegetables and Sweet Soy Glaze. 2. Season and prepare protein. 3. Cook protein using specified method. 4. Prepare sides and vegetables. 5. Combine all components and serve hot.

recipe.name: Mediterranean Shakshuka with Feta and Olives
recipe.instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 2. Add diced onion and bell pepper; sauté until soft, about 5 minutes. 3. Stir in minced garlic, smoked paprika, and cumin; cook for another minute. 4. Pour in the crushed tomatoes, season with salt and pepper, and simmer for 10 minutes. 5. Make small wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each well. 6. Cover the skillet and cook until the eggs are set to your liking, about 5-7 minutes. 7. Sprinkle with feta cheese, olives, and fresh parsley before serving.

recipe.name: Spicy Thai Quinoa Salad with Grilled Chicken
recipe.instructions: 1. In a pot, bring water to a boil and add quinoa. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes. 2. Fluff quinoa with a fork and let cool. 3. While quinoa is cooling, grill the chicken breast until fully cooked and slice. 4. In a large bowl, combine shredded cabbage, carrot, cucumber, cilantro, and cooled quinoa. 5. In a separate bowl, mix peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, and chili flakes until smooth to create dressing. 6. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. 7. Top with sliced grilled chicken before serving.

recipe.name: Default dinner
recipe.instructions: 1. Preheat oven or prepare cooking surface for Default dinner. 2. Season and prepare protein. 3. Cook protein using specified method. 4. Prepare sides and vegetables. 5. Combine all components and serve hot.

recipe.name: Spiced Cauliflower and Egg Fatteh
recipe.instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). 
2. Toss cauliflower florets with olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper, and roast in the oven for 20 minutes until golden. 
3. While the cauliflower is roasting, bring a large pot of water to a gentle simmer. 
4. Carefully crack eggs and poach them in the simmering water for 3-4 minutes until the whites are set, yolks still runny. 
5. In a bowl, mix tahini, minced garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste. Add water to reach desired consistency. 
6. In serving bowls, layer the torn pita pieces, roasted cauliflower, poached eggs, and drizzle with tahini sauce. 
7. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve immediately.

recipe.name: Mediterranean Mushroom Grain Bowl
recipe.instructions:
1. In a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Add quinoa, cover, and simmer on low for 15 minutes or until water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork. 
2. Meanwhile, in a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add sliced mushrooms and sauté for 5-7 minutes until golden brown. 
3. Stir in chickpeas, spinach, cumin, paprika, salt and pepper, cooking until spinach wilts (2-3 minutes). 
4. In a large bowl, combine quinoa, sautéed mushrooms and chickpeas, and drizzle with lemon juice. 
5. Serve topped with crumbled feta cheese and enjoy warm.

recipe.name: Default dinner
recipe.instructions: 1. Preheat oven or prepare cooking surface for Default dinner. 2. Season and prepare protein. 3. Cook protein using specified method. 4. Prepare sides and vegetables. 5. Combine all components and serve hot.

recipe.name: Spiced Chickpea Shakshuka with Harissa
recipe.instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onion and bell pepper, sauté until softened (about 5 minutes). 2. Stir in minced garlic, cumin, and harissa paste. Cook for another 2 minutes until fragrant. 3. Add the drained chickpeas and canned tomatoes (with juices). Bring to a simmer and season with salt and pepper. 4. Create wells in the mixture and crack an egg into each well. Cover and cook until the eggs are just set (about 5-7 minutes). 5. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving. Serve warm with crusty bread.

recipe.name: Quinoa and Roasted Veggie Buddha Bowl
recipe.instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). 2. Toss broccoli, carrots, red onion, and zucchini with olive oil, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper; spread on a baking sheet. 3. Roast veggies in the oven for about 20 minutes or until tender and caramelized. 4. While veggies roast, cook quinoa according to package instructions. 5. Assemble the bowl with a base of quinoa, topped with roasted veggies and fresh avocado slices. 6. Drizzle with lemon juice and sprinkle sesame seeds before serving.

recipe.name: Gourmet Pork Belly Tacos with Mango-C
recipe.instructions: 1. Preheat oven or prepare cooking surface for Gourmet Pork Belly Tacos with Mango-C. 2. Season and prepare protein. 3. Cook protein using specified method. 4. Prepare sides and vegetables. 5. Combine all components and serve hot.

recipe.name: Savory Mushroom and Broccoli Tamagoyaki
recipe.instructions: 1. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add sesame oil. 2. Sauté the chopped shiitake mushrooms until they are golden. 3. In a bowl, mix the beaten eggs, blanched broccoli, soy sauce, and mirin. 4. Pour a thin layer of the egg mixture into the skillet, tilting to coat. Let it cook for 1-2 minutes or until the edges start to set. 5. Add some sautéed mushrooms and roll the omelet towards the edge of the pan. 6. Repeat the process, adding more egg mixture and mushrooms as you roll until all are cooked. 7. Slide the tamagoyaki onto a cutting board, slice into pieces, and garnish with sliced green onions.

recipe.name: Mediterranean Quinoa Buddha Bowl
recipe.instructions: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Allow it to cool. 2. In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chickpeas, diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, and feta cheese. 3. In a small bowl, mix lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Drizzle this dressing over the bowl. 4. Toss gently to combine all ingredients. 5. Garnish with chopped parsley and pomegranate seeds before serving.

recipe.instructions: 1. Preheat oven or prepare cooking surface for Herbed Lamb Chop Soup with Cauliflower Purée. 2. Season and prepare protein. 3. Cook protein using specified method. 4. Prepare sides and vegetables. 5. Combine all components and serve hot.
